p: Antibacterial activity of EOs was evaluated by determining minimal inhibition concentrations (MICs) and minimal bactericidal concentrations (MBCs) in relation to the 50 E. coli isolates and reference strain ( Table 3). The MIC values of O. majorana EO ranged from 0.19 mg/mL to 0.78 mg/mL, while the MBC values ranged from 1.56 mg/mL to 12.5 mg/mL. These results indicated that bacteria isolated from female children (MIC from 0.19 to 0.39 mg/mL and MBC at 1.56 mg/mL) were more sensitive to this oil compared to other isolates. Further, strains isolated from male adults were the most resistant with MBC values going up 12.5 mg/mL.
